result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan C Niemi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Sign necessary releases so DOC can monitor compliance with treatment
*Get all prescriptions from one pharmacy
*Submit DNA sample, if not already done so

timeConds.notes:
*Allowed to serve on GPS electronic monitoring; to be served within the first 90 days of probation
*Huber for employment and any  counseling he may be involved in and community service

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan C Niemi

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Addendum to PSI - confidential
Character letters on behalf of the defendant

Defendant Nathan C Niemi in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:52 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the Record Review and the Addendum. 
Neither party has corrections. 
Court has received letters in support of the defendant. 

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barrette makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Hess. 

BY THE COURT:  
Count 1 - 
Sentence Withheld.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Continue with AODA counseling and treatment. 
Sign necessary releases so DOC can monitor compliance with treatment.
Get all prescriptions from one pharmacy. 
Serve 60 days jail. 
Allowed to serve on GPS Electronic Monitoring to be served within the first 90 days of probation. 
Huber for employment, any counseling he may be involved in and community service. 
Pay fine of $250 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so. 
60 Hours Community Service.  

Atty Barrette questions the Court re: volunteer hours of the defendant while on GPS.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 31, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

2:15 p.m. Defendant Nathan C Niemi in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing recommendations to the Court. 
Atty Barrette concurs with joint argreement. 

BY THE COURT:****Record Review Ordered to be provided by 12-30-16.
Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Nathan C Niemi in court with attorney Melissa Louise Barrette. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
